holidays.name: Global Forgiveness Day
holidays.description: A day dedicated to encouraging people around the world to forgive grudges and let go of resentment for a happier life.
holidays.origin: Started by the World Forgiveness Alliance in 1998, this day promotes emotional healing and reconciliation.
holidays.funFact: Forgiveness has been scientifically linked to reduced stress and improved heart health!

holidays.name: Tell the Truth Day
holidays.description: A quirky observance encouraging everyone to speak honestly for an entire day — no white lies allowed!
holidays.origin: Created by author and artist Michael X. McCarthy in 2010 as a way to promote honesty and integrity.
holidays.funFact: People trying this often realize how many tiny fibs they tell daily — honesty can be surprisingly challenging!

holidays.name: World Chocolate Day
holidays.description: A sweet celebration honoring the introduction of chocolate to Europe in 1550.
holidays.origin: Commemorates when chocolate was first brought to Europe from the Americas and turned into a decadent treat.
holidays.funFact: The average American consumes nearly 12 pounds of chocolate annually! Chocolate originated from the cacao bean used by the ancient Aztecs.

holidays.name: National Bikini Day (USA)
holidays.description: An unofficial holiday marking the anniversary of the bikini's debut on the French Riviera in 1946 by designer Louis Réard.
holidays.origin: Named after the Bikini Atoll nuclear tests, the swimsuit was considered as explosive in fashion as the tests were in physics!
holidays.funFact: The bikini was initially banned by some countries for being too risqué — talk about making waves!
